Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(b) Denial of any essential program service as punishment.
These include, but are not limited to, the following:
1

(iv) Shelter, clothing, medical care, or essential personal
needs, including culturally specific items.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/26/2023, Youth was placed in her room only wearing a
diaper. A gown was in the room, but youth was not allowed to put
it on.
Investigation Interviews
A voicemail was left for Complainant on June 29, 2023, asking
if there was additional information to please return the phone
call. A return phone call was never received.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth A said while in her room she had been provided
with a safety gown however took it off and refused to put it back
on. Youth A said at the end of the incident she was given an adult
diaper due to her having her period and not being able to have
regular underwear because of her self-harming behaviors. Youth A
said she also had a safety blanket in her room to use while
sleeping.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth B said she saw Staff 3 provide Youth A with a
safety gown. Youth B said she does not know what else Youth A
had in her room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 1 said Youth A was given a safety gown and safety
blanket on the night of June 26, 2023. Staff 1 said Youth A was
self-harming with the safety gown so at one point it had to be
removed but she still had the safety blanket. Staff 1 said once
Youth A agreed not to self-harm, she was given the safety gown
back.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 2 said Youth A had been given both a safety gown and
safety blanket and was allowed to use both.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 3 said Youth A had been given a safety blanket, safety
gown, and diaper to cover herself. Staff 3 said Youth A was never
left in her room without something to cover up with.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 4 said she does not know what Youth A was given
while she was placed her room as she was not working that unit.
2

Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 5 said when he placed Youth A in her room, she had a
safety blanket and an adult diaper to use.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility, on July 20, 2023.
Supervisor said when Youth A was placed in her room on June 26,
2023, she had a safety blanket and diaper throughout the night.
Supervisor said she is not aware of what was given to her the next
day.
Analysis After interviews with youth and staff, the facility is found in
compliance with Intervention Standards. The staff did provide
Youth A was a safety gown, safety blanket, and adult diaper in her
room to cover herself which she was allowed to wear.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An unknown male staff dragged Youth down the hallway back to
her room and other children saw. A female staff member sat on
youth.
Investigation Interviews
A voicemail was left for Complainant on June 29, 2023, asking
if there was additional information to please return the phone
call. A return phone call was never received.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth A said she was naked and got out of her room
and fell to the floor at which time Staff 3 was over top of her with
her knees on either side of her stomach. Youth A said Staff 3 was
“just trying to cover me” and denied any pressure being placed on
her stomach from Staff 3. Youth A said she got away from Staff 3
and was sitting in a chair and the staff were all asking her to return
to her room and trying to get her to move back to her room which
she refused to do. Youth A said Staff 5 stood her up and carried
her to her room and placed her on the floor and shut the door.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth B said when Youth A came out of her room naked,
3

Staff 3 “got on top of her” and was trying to cover her up. Youth B
said she did not know if Staff 3 had any of her weight on Youth A.
Youth B said she was placed in her bedroom however was able to
see out of her bedroom window. Youth B said Youth A had gotten
into a chair in the corner of the room and all female staff were
surrounding her and covering her with a blanket. Youth B said
Staff 5 came on the unit and picked Youth A up from behind and
moved her into her room and shut the door. Youth B said she did
not see if Youth A’s feet left the ground at any time when Staff 5
moved her to her room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 1 said Staff 3 was “on top” of Youth A however she
does not know if Staff 3 was placing any pressure on Youth A.
Staff 1 said Staff 5 did pick Youth A up by her armpits from the
sitting position and “move” her to her room. Staff 1 said she does
not know if Youth A’s feet ever left the ground or if she was walking
with him.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 2 said she did not see any staff sit on Youth A. Staff 2
said Staff 5 picked Youth A up from the seated position under her
arms and escorted her to her room. Staff 2 said she never saw
Youth A’s feet leave the ground.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 3 said she did straddle herself over Youth A by placing
one knee on either side of Youth A. Staff 3 denied ever placing any
weight on Youth A. Staff 3 said Staff 5 did pick Youth A up from a
seated position into a standing position and walked her to her
room, Staff 3 never saw Youth A’s feet leave the ground.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 4 said she never saw anyone sitting on Youth A. Staff 4
said Staff 5 did come behind where Youth A was sitting, pick her
up into a standing position, and walk her to her room. Staff 4 said
she does not recall Youth A feet ever leaving the ground.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 5 said he did not see any staff sitting on Youth A. Staff
5 said he did pick Youth A up under her arms from a seated
position to standing and walk her to her room. Staff 5 denied
picking Youth A up where her feet were off the ground.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility, on July 20, 2023.
Supervisor said Staff 3 was straddling overtop of Youth A however
4

did not see any pressure being placed on Youth A’s body and was
doing so to cover her naked body from the other youth. Supervisor
said Staff 5 picked Youth A up from a seated position and was
behind her walking her into her room. Supervisor said she did not
see Youth A’s feet leave the ground.
Video Review
Video footage of June 26, 2023, was reviewed on July 19,
2023. The video shows Youth A crawling out of her room naked
and Staff 3 taking ahold of her and then straddling across her
midsection, with one knee on either side of Youth A’s stomach.
Staff 3 is seen leaning forward using her hands to block Youth A’s
breasts. Staff 3 was handed a blanket she then held that up in
front of Youth A. As soon as all other youth were placed in their
rooms Staff 3 is seen moving to one side of Youth A.
Youth A is seen on the floor with multiple staff sitting around her.
Staff 5 is seen coming behind where Youth A is seated and
picking her up in her armpit area, is behind her, and moves her to
her room. Youth A’s feet are not seen leaving the ground.
Analysis In all interviews with staff, they noted Youth A was naked and they
wanted to get her into her bedroom because she was naked.
After interviews with youth and staff, as well as video review of the
incident, the facility is found in compliance with Intervention
Standards. Youth A stated Staff 3 did straddle across her however
denied her sitting on her or putting any pressure on her, all staff
interviewed reported the same information.
Youth A said Staff 5 “carried” her to her room, however all staff
report that Staff 5 picked Youth A up from a seated position to a
standing position and walked her to her room and her feet never
left the ground. The video review revealed the same information
presented in the interviews with staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and
Description elimination.
(4) Staff must only use seclusion as a temporary response to
prevent life-threatening injury or serious bodily harm when other
interventions are ineffective.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was left in her room all day.
5

Investigation Interviews
A voicemail was left for Complainant on June 29, 2023, asking
if there was additional information to please return the phone
call. A return phone call was never received.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth A said she was placed in her room on the evening
of June 26, 2023, and did not rejoin her group until the morning of
June 28, 2023. Youth A said she came out of her room for
showering, therapy sessions, and to make a phone call to her
mother, otherwise she spent the day in her room. Youth A said she
slept most of the day. Youth A said she was in a safety gown the
entire time she was in her room.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth B said Youth A did not rejoin their group until June
28, 2023. Youth B said Youth A was in her room in a safety gown
when she was on the unit. Youth B said when a youth is in a
safety gown they are not allowed out on the unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 1 said she worked on June 27, 2023, and said Youth A
was in a safety gown all day due to her behaviors and therefore
cannot be on the pod wearing only the gown. Staff 1 said Youth A
did shower and was able to talk to her therapist however she does
not know if she was out of her room any other time.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 2 said she did not have direct contact with Youth A on
June 27, 2023; however, she did hear over the radio that Youth A
was still refusing to put clothing on and was naked in her room
throughout the day.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 3 said she is unaware of when Youth A was allowed
out of her room the following day.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 4 said she did not have contact with Youth A after she
was placed in her room on June 26, 2023.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility, on July 20, 2023.
Supervisor said Youth A was placed in her room after the incident
on June 26, 2023. Supervisor said Youth A’s door was open for
medication passing at 8:30am and was still refusing to put on
clothing. Supervisor said the doors were closed then for shift
6

change and then she left and was not sure what time Youth A was
allowed out for the day.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Youth A’s behavior observation log for June 27, 2023. Youth
A requested to stay in her room and sleep in the morning
and slept until lunch. Youth A then requested to eat in her
room which she was allowed to do. At 1:15pm Youth A
participated in a therapy session and a face time call with
her mother. Youth A then refused to place on clothing and
went back into her room and fell asleep. At 3:45pm Youth A
was out of her room on the pod talking with staff until
5:30pm when she showered. Youth A then requested to go
back into her room as she did not want to be around her
group and the request was granted. Youth A then stayed in
her room until bedtime.
Analysis After interviews with Youth A and staff, as well as documentation
review, it is determined the facility is in compliance with Seclusion
within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions;
reduction and elimination. Youth A reported she was out of her
room to participate in therapy, make a phone call to her mother,
and shower, and then slept most of the day. The staff interviews
and documentation reviewed reported that Youth A was on suicide
precautions and in a safety gown for the morning, was able to
come out of her room for therapy, to make a phone call, and
shower, however then requested to remain in her room for the day
due to her peers being very angry with her about the prior night
and her not wanting to be with her group that day.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior Management
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall include
Description all of the following:
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management, and
social skills.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff lack proper intervention strategies for youth that disrobe.
Investigation Interviews
A voicemail was left for Complainant on June 29, 2023, asking
if there was additional information to please return the phone
call. A return phone call was never received.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth A said she was upset on June 26, 2023, because
7

a staff member had told her that if she did good on her program,
they would bring her in a birthday gift however then Staff 3 told her
that staff may not bring in something for one youth but rather they
have to bring it in for the whole group. Youth A said she was also
very upset because her family was not going to be coming to see
her on her birthday. Youth A said because of being upset at these
two things she stomped out of the dining hall and went into the
gym without permission. Youth A said she went back to her unit
after a few minutes and took a break in her room. Youth A said she
came back out of her room to “process with staff” however a peer
made a comment about it being “pointless” which made her upset,
so she ran into her room and began to self-harm. Youth A said
Staff 2 came into her room and was talking with her and asking
her to stop scratching her arms while Staff 1 was taking all the
items out of her room. Youth A said she was asked to change into
a safety gown due to the self-harm and eventually she agreed.
Youth A said she then began to self-harm with a bracelet and took
off the safety gown and began to rip it apart and took a string from
it and tied it around her neck and arm. Youth A said Staff 3 came
into her room and took the gown and she blocked the door to
prevent Staff 3 from closing it. Youth A said Staff 3 was kicking
Youth A’s feet and told her she was “disgusting” which triggered
her, and she said she felt that she “had to get out of that room”.
Youth A said she crawled past Staff 3 and fell face-up on the
ground and Staff 3 got on top of her with her knees on either side
of her stomach to stop her from getting on the pod naked. Youth A
said Staff 3 was “just trying to cover me” and then called for staff
assistance and as soon as other staff arrived moved to the side of
Youth A. Youth A said as soon as Staff 3 was on her side she got
up and ran to a chair in the corner of the room and sat down.
Youth A said the staff were around her asking her to go to her
room and she was pinching, kicking, and hitting them because she
wanted to stay in the chair. Youth A said Staff 5 then restrained her
and carried her to her room and placed her on the floor with a
blanket and shut the door. Youth A said she then put on a diaper
due to having her period and laid down with the blanket for the
remainder of the night. Youth A said the following day she had
therapy and took a shower however remained in her room in a
safety gown for the rest of the day. Youth A stated the staff were
helping her throughout the situation to the best of their ability.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023. Youth B said Youth A was upset on June 26, 2023,
because she was told if a staff brings something in for one youth
then they have to bring something for all youth. Youth B said Youth
A walked out of the dining hall and into the gym without
8

permission. Youth B said she and the other youth were brought
back to their rooms so staff could “deal with” Youth A. Youth B said
she was watching out her bedroom window and saw Youth A walk
into her room and shut the door on her own accord. Youth B said
she and the other youth were then let out of their rooms and they
were “hanging out” in their common area. Youth B said Youth A
began to self-harm in her room so Staff 3 took all the items out of
Youth A’s room and gave her a safety gown. Youth B said Youth A
began to self-harm again with the safety gown so she and all other
youth were brought into the gym by Supervisor. Youth B said after
a while she and the other youth were brought back to the unit and
Youth A was in her room with the door closed. Youth B said Staff 3
was doing a check on Youth A and when the door was opened
Youth A came out of her room “completely naked”. Youth B said
Staff 3 “got on top of her” and was trying to cover her up. Youth B
said she was very upset by Youth A’s behaviors stating it was
“very triggering” for many youth including her. Youth B said she
and the other youth were placed in their rooms while Staff 3 was
trying to cover Youth A up. Youth B said she was able to see out of
her bedroom window that Youth A had gotten into a chair in the
corner of the room and all female staff were surrounding her and
covering her with a blanket. Youth B said Staff 5 came on the unit
and picked Youth A up from behind and moved her into her room
and shut the door. Youth B said Youth A remained in her room for
the rest of the night. Youth B said it was approximately 6pm when
Youth A went into her room. Youth B said Youth A did not rejoin the
group until June 28, 2023. Youth B said many of the youth on her
unit were very upset by Youth A’s behaviors.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 1 said she has been employed at Bay Pines Center as
a Youth Aide since June 10, 2023. Staff 1 said she was working on
Youth A’s unit with Staff 3 on June 26, 2023. Staff 1 said Youth A
was “acting up” in the dining hall at dinner time, stomping her feet
and “mouthing off”. Staff 1 said Youth A eventually ran out of the
dining hall and a supervisor was called for assistance. Staff 1 said
she stayed in the dining hall with the other youth and supervised
them eating their dinner and then brought them back to the unit.
Staff 1 said when she arrived back at the unit Youth A was in her
bedroom. Staff 1 said Youth A was self-harming and there was
blood on her arm where she was scratching herself. Staff 1 said it
was decided Youth A needed to be in a safety gown so she was
assisting as Staff 3 and Staff 2 were working with Youth A in her
room to get her to change into the gown and remove items from
her room. Staff 1 said Youth A refused to change into the safety
gown but after several minutes of talking with her she eventually
9

agreed and changed over into the gown. Staff 1 said once Youth A
was in the safety gown the staff exited the room and the door was
closed. Staff 1 said Youth A took off her safety gown and was
naked in her room, she would not respond to staff talking to her,
and was ripping up her safety gown and harming herself with it.
Staff 1 said Staff 3 opened Youth A’s door to remove the safety
gown due to her using it for self-harm and when Staff 3 did this
Youth A got in front of her door and would not allow Staff 3 to shut
it. Staff 1 said Staff 3 was trying to move Youth A away from the
door when Youth A was able to get past Staff 3 and out into the
pod where the other youth were located. Staff 1 said she called for
staff assistance and began getting the other youth in their rooms.
Staff 1 said Staff 3 was “on top” of Youth A trying to cover her and
then got a blanket to shield Youth A’s naked body from being seen
by other youth. Staff 1 said Staff 3 moved off of Youth A and
several other female staff were attempting to help however Youth
A got up and ran across the pod into a chair. Staff 1 said several
female staff were trying to cover Youth A up with a blanket and get
her to go back into her room however Youth A was kicking staff
and pushing the blanket off her. Staff 1 said she got gloves and
was making sure all staff had gloves because Youth A was
covered in her own menstrual blood. Staff 1 said Youth A resisted
the female staff until Staff 5 eventually walked over and lifted
Youth A under her armpits and moved her into her room, set her
on the ground, and shut her door.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June 28,
2023. Staff 2 said she was working on June 26, 2023, when she
was called to assist with Youth A multiple times throughout the
evening due to her behaviors. Staff 2 said the first time she was
called to the unit, Youth A was in her room cutting her arm and
picking her scab from a previous wound. Staff 2 said Youth A was
not being violent but rather sitting on her bed not talking to
anyone. Staff 2 said she and Staff 3 went into the room and while
Staff 3 was clearing items out of Youth A’s room she was
attempting to talk to Youth A. Staff 2 said she cleaned up the blood
off Youth A’s arm and gave her ointment and Band-Aids to cover it.
Staff 2 said she then left the unit however was called back shortly
after and Youth A had a lot of blood on her arm again and was
wiping it all over her arm. Staff 2 said she and Staff 3 went back
into the room and noticed there was not really any kind of cut for
the amount of blood on her arm. Staff 2 said Staff 3 then moved
Youth A’s mattress and found a large blood clot under it which
made them quickly realize Youth A was on her menstrual period
and wiping that blood on her arm. Staff 2 said Youth A was still not
talking to staff at that point which was concerning given her
10

behaviors. Staff 2 said she stayed in the room with Youth A talking
to her while Staff 3 got a safety gown, safety blanket, and tampon
for Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A refused the tampon however it
was not safe to give her underwear for fear she would use it to
self-harm and therefore she was given a Depends diaper to use.
Staff 2 said Youth A eventually changed into the safety gown on
her own however did not use the diaper. Staff 2 said she left the
unit however was then called down a third time due to Youth A
getting out of her room naked. Staff 2 said when she got there,
Staff 3 was on the ground next to Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A got
up and went to sit in a chair across the room. Staff 2 said there
were several staff there and were trying to cover Youth A with a
blanket. Staff 2 said at one point Youth A punched Staff 3 in the
chest and was fighting against the staff to go back to her room.
Staff 2 said Staff 5 then walked behind Youth A, picked her up
under her arms from her seated position, and escorted her too her
room. Staff 2 said Youth A had a blanket partially wrapped around
her and between her and Staff 5. Staff 2 said Staff 5 placed Youth
A in her room and shut the door. Staff 2 said she then left the unit.
Staff 2 said she has not had contact with Youth A since that night
however did process the situation with the group of youth that are
on Youth A’s pod. Staff 2 said the youth that were exposed to
Youth A’s naked body and behaviors were very upset and felt
“traumatized” by the event.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 20,
2023. Staff 3 said she was working Youth A’s unit on June 26,
2023. Staff 3 said Youth A was upset and left the dining hall during
dinner and went into the gym. Staff 3 said she followed Youth A
and redirected her to leave the gym and go back to the pod, which
she did without issue. Staff 3 said Youth A went into her room, but
the door was left open, and Staff 3 saw Youth A rubbing her arm
with an eraser repeatedly which was leaving a burn on her arm
and therefore Staff 3 said she contacted the supervisor and had
Staff 2 come on the pod. Staff 3 said she cleared Youth A’s room
while Staff 2 was talking with Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A was
given a safety gown to change into due to self-harm, which she
did willingly and both she and Staff 2 exited the room. Staff 3 said
when she did a check on Youth A she was burning her arm with
the Velcro on the safety gown and there was blood all over her
arm. Staff 3 said she and Staff 2 once again entered the room and
were talking to Youth A and removed the safety gown and gave
her a safety blanket. Staff 3 said as she and Staff 2 were cleaning
up the blood they realized Youth A’s arm was not bleeding but
rather she had her menstrual period and was wiping her blood on
her arm and her mattress. Staff 3 said she told Youth A wiping her
11

menstrual blood all over her and her room was “disgusting”. Staff
3 denied every calling Youth A disgusting but rather pointing out
the behavior was disgusting. Staff 3 said she and Staff 2 put on
gloves and cleaned Youth A up as well as her room, and then
exited the room. Staff 3 said during the next room check, Youth A
was ripping up the safety blanket. Staff 3 said she then opened
the door to remove the blanket due to the threats Youth A had
made of self-harm and her ability to rip the blanket up. Staff 3 said
she took one end of the blanket and she and Youth A did a “tug of
war” type movement until she was able to get the blanket away
from Youth a. Staff 3 said Youth A then moved her naked body in
front of her bedroom door so that Staff 3 could not shut the door.
Staff 3 said she attempted to move Youth A away from the door
and Youth A got under Staff 3’s legs and moved out of her room
onto the pod naked where all the other youth were. Staff 3 said
she stopped her from getting to far out of her room by getting on
top of Youth A, who was already crawling on the ground, and then
straddled her with one knee on either side of Youth A’s waist in
attempts to cover her up so the other youth did not see her naked.
Staff 3 said this is not an approved Handle with Care technique
however she did not know what else to do to protect both Youth A
and the other girls from Youth A’s naked body. Staff 3 said she
never placed any of her weight on Youth A. Staff 3 said another
staff handed her a blanket and she held it up to block the other
youth from seeing Youth A, while the staff were getting the other
youth into their bedrooms. Staff 3 said she then moved to the side
of Youth A and Youth A got up and ran to a chair in the corner of
the room. Staff 3 said she and several other female staff were
attempting to cover Youth A with a blanket and she continually
pushed it away. Staff 3 said she and the other staff were trying to
talk Youth A into going back into her room and she refused. Staff 3
said she and other staff were trying to get Youth A up and escort
her to her room and Youth A kept pinching and scratching staff.
Staff 3 said Youth A finally got up and when the staff went to escort
her to her room she fell to the ground, taking most of the staff with
